sub_topic: Finding the Ramsey number of a graph.
message_1: What is the smallest number such that any graph with that number of nodes either contains a clique of size 5 or an independent set of size 5? (This is the Ramsey number R(5,5))
message_2: The Ramsey number R(5,5) is the smallest number such that any graph with that number of nodes either contains a clique of size 5 or an independent set of size 5. The value of R(5,5) is 43.
